result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Clippard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all other fees, surcharges and excluding the domestic abuse assessment by 03-11-16. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond J Clippard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness VICKI T.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request X26207206 1X 3/11/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Vicki T. will be returned to DAs Victim/Witness Services for SIGNATURE, approval, and date confirmation.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. 
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served. 

- Defendant to pay all other fees, surgcharges and excluding domestic abuse assessment by 03-11-2016. Any remaining amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Raymond J Clippard not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 3/11/15 in Branch 40.  State is still trying to get the 911 call to give to the defense.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Raymond J Clippard not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Vicki T.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
